Про данный акт творчества Valve сказано уже, наверное, все. Однако от себя добавлю, что как и почти двадцать лет назад - Half-Life 2 отличный шутерок. С сюжетом, с бодрым игровым процессом и всеми остальными составляющими. Более того, лично для меня Half-Life 2 прошла проверку временем. К сожалению немногие игры могут этим похвастать в последнее время.

I'm known by my primary Steam account here: https://steamcommunity.com/id/MoeJama/. I own this game in my alternate account, the one I'm using to write this review.

No wonder this title sold millions of copies -- this game is INCREDIBLE! After I had played the first Half-Life game, I was eager for more of this sweet first-person shooter, and so I bought this game and played through it...when I finished it, I was literally speechless. I felt like I was playing Garry's Mod, only it was the most immersive experience I had ever had (with the exception of Half-Life: Alyx)! With clearer audio and modern graphics, I felt like I was in another world...a different Earth on which the crippling City 17 was in the center of all the chaos that was going down. Then the infamous Gordon Freeman emerged, and I got to control all of his heroic actions towards winning a war that should've been won many years prior to the time in which Gordon emerged once again. The battle was finally won (somewhat), but the mysterious G-Man was still at large...and when the game ended just like that, I grew hungry for more, for a chance to finally claim a world out of the hands of evil -- I went ahead and purchased episodes 1 & 2 following the completion of this game. That's how GOSH-DARN BEAUTIFUL this game really is!

Thank you for delivering such an amazing video game experience to the Steam Community, Valve. Credit goes to all your creative, hard-working employees, including the glorious Gabe Newell. I loved playing every second of Half-Life 2, and I never will stop loving the Half-Life series overall. All the work that is put into games like this one is surely worth all the positive reception. Thanks again!

[h1] Jogo mais superestimado que o mundo já viu [/h1]

A única parte compreensível é a Source Engine, que elevou a física dos jogos a um patamar impressionante pra época; a história não tem nada de tão especial, muito menos o gameplay e a ambientação que tanto mamam, o que eu vejo é uma lambeção de saco sem fim depois de tanto esmiuçarem a lore do negócio, digo, isso pode ser feito com praticamente qualquer jogo. 

É legalzinho e tudo mais, e tudo bem ter achado "o melhor FPS já feito" NA ÉPOCA, mas esse tempo já foi. Ainda bem que a Valve soube surfar no hype dessa tristeza pra expandir a Steam, onde finalmente temos jogos que merecem glorificação. 

A falta que uns jogo que preste não fazem na vida de um fanboy.

This game is the best game ever made. What you get is the map surrounded by your enemies. It's fun to kill your enemies and stuff. When you get to the puzzle section, it amazes me, it has like some sort of physics type of puzzle. It made my eyes tear, because it looks beautiful to this day. It gives the nostalgic feel to it. I've never played it, I started with Episode 2. So before I installed this game, I think about it, I want to give it a try for myself. After I installed it, it tears me. I even run it on Intel Celeron CPU with Intel HD Graphics And 4 GB Of DDR3. And it runs great. Holy cow. It's the best moment. Now how about you? If you think about it, whether you want to play it or not, or got bored with any other games. How about give this game a try? Maybe it'll cheer up for you. Anyways, the game is great, the best and ever.

No need to tell anything about the game - 16 years of demands for Half-Life 3 speak for themselves.

What I can tell you - download Mmod from Modb dot com, which expands gunplay, making the gameplay more Counter-Strike`ish. It adds new animations, two guns, adds weapon inspection and makes the Alliance troopers really deadly. Unfortunately, it makes allies even more useless. I found out that Alyx and Barney can be actually killed, never had that during my OG gameplay.

And, yes, the achievements work with it.

Ah, Half-Life 2. I actually didn't play this until I got it on Steam, and I was... Underwhelmed? It's a great game, but it felt a lot less like Half-Life than the first for some reason. It felt like the focus of a lot of the levels was "Woah look at how big this is" or "Yooo look at the cool physics" rather than actively trying to world build. However all that aside, it's still a fun game. Quite exploitable and empty at times, but still enjoyable. It follows life in the aftermath of the resonance cascade and the world has been overrun, which isn't an area too many games like to delve into after covering the whole "world ending scenario" thing.
pick up that can

I've never played any Half-Life game before I played this, which means I didn't know the story before but with no connection of the story I still wanted to play the game because it was very good, just the game-play is amazing (Maybe not the physics) but that didn't matter.
It's also very suspenseful which intrigued me more for not even knowing who these characters are luckily, what was going on was easy to follow (which means I knew what was going on, just the backstory of Gordon Freeman and all the other character's I didn't know or even why the combine are after me)

In the end it's a good game just start with the first one.

PS: I've played them all now so I now know what was happening

PPS: Sorry I talked about my experience let's just say this game is one of my favorite games ever you should give it a shot
